results.title: Paris when it sizzles
results.creator_credit: Richard Quine, George Axelrod and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Richard Benson is an aging screenwriter and a cynical lush who has been commissioned to write a screenplay for Alexander Meyerheimer, a powerful Hollywood producer. Benson has spent several paid weeks in France drinking and carousing, and so far has only managed to conjure up the opening credits. Benson engages the services of typist Gabrielle Simpson to assist with the task of writing the script, which is due in two days. As Gabrielle and Richard brainstorm ideas for the film the various scenarios and plot contrivances that they conjure up are played before the audience, making “Paris when it sizzles”, the classic film within a film. The two collaborators run the gamut of movie character cliche - playboy, gangster, ingenue, vampire, femme fatale, the hooker with the heart of gold - imagining themselves in the key roles. Set in Paris, the film sends up techniques such as the dissolve, the cross and double cross, and the final kiss that seduces filmgoers as well as having digs at the French New wave and method acting. Despite being a romantic comedy, “Paris when it sizzles” takes a rather cynical view of the filmmaking business. Features cameos from Marlene Dietrich and Tony Curtis.

results.title: An Affair to remember [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Leo McCarey, Jerry Wald and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Debonair playboy Nickie Ferrante (Cary Grant) and beautiful nightclub singer Terry McKay (Deborah Kerr) meet travelling first class aboard a transatlantic luxury liner courtesy of two other people. She is a tycoon’s mistress and he is engaged to an heiress. Their sudden, but undeniable love affair leads them to make a vow - that they will break off their current relationships, get jobs and meet in six months to continue their affair. However, a tragic accident prevents Terry from keeping their rendezvous and the lovers future takes an emotional and uncertain turn. This film is a remake of Leo McCarey’s “Love Story” and Vic Damone croons the title tune on the soundtrack.

results.title: Gentleman's agreement [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Phil Green (Gregory Peck) is a single father and journalist lured to New York as a feature writer for a magazine. Assigned to write about anti-semitism, he struggles to find the right angle from which to explore this issue from a more personal perspective. Unrelenting in his quest for truth, Phil poses as a Jew and encounters prejudice first hand. Determined to expose intolerance and hypocrisy, he confronts those who blatantly practice anti-semitism and challenges those close to him who support it by remaining silent. Includes original theatrical trailer and Movietone News footage. Cast also includes Dorothy McGuire, John Garfield, Celeste Holm, Anne Revere, June Havoc and Dean Stockwell. Screenplay by Moss Hart, based on the original story by Laura Z. Hobson. Cinematography by Arthur Miller. Music by Alfred Newman. (Academy Awards: Best Film, Best Director, Best Supporting Actress)

results.title: Bamboozled [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Spike Lee, Jon Kilik and 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks
results.brief_description: Shot on digital video (by cinematographer Ellen Kuras) and taking it’s title from a Malcolm X speech (“You’ve been led astray, led amok, you’ve been bamboozled”), Spike Lee’s “Bamboozled” is an ambitious and contentious satire, a dazzling balancing act that at times strains under it’s own ingenuity but never fails to provoke and challenge. Damon Wayans stars as a successful and affected television executive, Pierre Delacroix, who is pressured by his wannabe home-boy boss (Michael Rapaport) to create a hit series tailored for African Americans. Frustrated by the implicit racism that dominates the entertainment industry, Delacroix comes up with a show that he feels white America really wants to see, a minstrel show called ‘Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show’. His offensive joke backfires however when ‘Mantan’ becomes a runaway success. Lee takes firm pot shots at various institutions, interspersing the film with racially coded advertising and racist images from America’s shameful filmic past (including much loved American classics, “Birth of a nation” and “Gone with the wind”). Not surprising then that Lee dedicates the film to Budd Schulberg, the writer of Eliza Kazan’s 1957 media satire, “A face in the crowd”. Cast includes Jada Pinkett-Smith, Savion Glover and Tommy Davidson.

results.title: Planet of the apes [Box set special edition]
results.creator_credit: Don Taylor, Franklin J. Schaffner, J Thompson, Ted Post, Arthur P. Jacobs and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The original “Planet of the apes” film and the five sequels it spawned about a future world of intelligent apes, and their interactions with humans. “Planet of the apes”: in the year 1972, Taylor and his crew set off to colonise the nearest habitable planet. Crash-landing two millennia later, they awake in a world dominated by intelligent apes, where ‘primitive’ humans are used for experimentation and sport. “Beneath the planet of the apes”: following Taylor’s crew into the unknown, Brent finds himself stranded in the same mad world. Struggling to stay one step ahead, he stumbles into the crossfire of an ape offensive against a race of telepathic humans. “Escape from the planet of the apes”: escaping the fiery end of the their world, three apes travel back in time, to a past where mankind rules over all. “Conquest of the planet of the apes”: as Caeser, a baby ape, grows into maturity, he discovers mankind’s cruel mistreatment of primates. It is the flash point setting for the upheaval of society as both apes and humans know it. “Battle for the planet of the Apes”: Caeser’s dream has come true; the emancipation of apes from the tyrannical rule of human society. Cast includes Charlton Heston, Roddy McDowall, Kim Hunter, Maurice Evans, Linda Harrison, Ricardo Montalban, Natalie Trundy, James Franciscus, Don Murray, Claude Akins, Severen Darden. Music: Jerry Goldsmith (original, 1971), Leonard Rosenman (1969, 1973), Tom Scott (1972)

results.title: Tora! tora! tora!
results.creator_credit: Kinji Fukasaku, Richard Fleischer, Toshio Masuda, Elmo Williams and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Tora! Tora! Tora! was an epic and expensive production that attempted to present realistically the battle for Pearl Harbour and the ensuing warring between the American and Japanese armies in World War II. In a unique approach, the battle is presented from both sides, rejecting traditional notions of one-sided jingoistic storytelling, typical of many war films from the 50s and 60s. For the Japanese section directors Toshio Masuda and Kinji Fukasaku pay close attention to the military manoeuvring and blunders of the campaign as well as the infighting and personal clashes within the high command. For the American section, the army is depicted as unsuspecting of an attack of this scale, hampered by limited technology and a lack of foresight. Exciting battle sequences and detailed inner-sanctum decision making within both sides of the battle make “Tora! Tora! Tora!” an interesting war movie that is not simplistic in its politics and is effective in its recreation of a historically significant event. Cast includes Martin Balsam, So Yamamura, Joseph Cotton, Tatsuya Mihashi, E.G. Marshall, James Whitemore, Takahiro Tamura, Eijiro Tono, Jason Robards.

results.title: The Poseidon adventure
results.creator_credit: Ronald Neame, Irwin Allen and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: One of the finest disaster/adventure movies of the 1970s, “The Poseidon adventure” is set on an ocean liner, capsized by a ninety-foot tidal wave one New Year’s Eve. With the boat upside down in the water, a dozen survivors make a desperate dash for the bottom of the boat - their only way out. The camaraderie of the group is tested as they face constant danger of flooding and explosions, struggling through six levels of the boat, headed for the bowels of the ship. Aside from impressive special effects, the film essentially boils down to a battle of wills between two rival leaders of the posse - a no-nonsense reverend (Gene Hackman) and a hothead detective, Mike Rogo (Ernest Borgnine). “The Poseidon adventure” was nominated for seven Academy awards, and won two, for Best Song and a Special Achievement Award for visual effects. Adapted from the novel by Paul Gallico.

results.title: Himalaya
results.creator_credit: Eric Valli, Christophe Barratier and Antelope Films
results.brief_description: Himalaya is a story about the struggle between two men to hold power in a small village in Nepal. Tinle is the old chief who loses his son in the annual salt caravan. Tinle holds Karma responsible and refuses to allow him to lead the next expedition to sell salt to buy much needed grain to survive the coming winter. Karma has some support in the village and decides to leave four days before the date decided by the village elders. Tinle is furious and sets off with his own team including his daughter in-law, grandson and some other elders. The cinematography in this film is amazing, Barratier having previously been a photographer for “National Geographic”.

results.title: Faithless = Trolosa [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Liv Ullman, Kaj Larsen, Ab Svensk Film Industri, Sf Norge As, SVT Drama, Yle Vianello and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: Liv Ullman, best known for her acting in iconic films by Ingmar Bergman, directs “Faithless”, from a script by Bergman. “Faithless” is the story of a bourgeois Swedish family whose lives are put asunder by an extra-marital affair. Marianne (Lena Andre) is happily married to composer Markus (Thomas Hanzon), living with their young daughter, Isabelle. David (Krister Henriksson), a friend to both Marianne and Markus, is a hapless writer and theatre director, onto his troubled second marriage, and a frequent visitor to the family home. David is depicted as a charming rogue with a self-destructive streak, filled with self-loathing. One night, when Markus is away on tour, David proposes to Marianne that they sleep together. Marianne refuses but her interest is piqued and the sanctity of her family unit is doomed. Told in extended flashback sequences, Marianne relays her story to the narrator, Bergman (Erland Josephson), who listens patiently, coercing Marianne to confess her indiscretions. This set-up, at a beautiful, remote beachside retreat, is reminiscent of many Ingmar Bergman films, in particular “Persona”. “Faithless” employs a leisurely pace to unfurl this tale of morality, betrayal, love and revenge, between three consenting adults and an innocent child. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Exorcist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, William Peter Blatty and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Exorcist occupies a central position in the history of horror films, an almost sadistically malevolent experience in terror. Regan (Linda Blair) is a young girl entering puberty and she becomes possessed by the spirit of an ancient demon. Her mother (Ellen Burstyn) finds that there is no assistance in the scientific pragmatism of the modern world and she hesitantly turns to the occult rites of Catholicism and Orthodoxy in order to rid her daughter of the monster. The exorcism scenes attain a disturbing authenticity and they are based on the official Catholic Church rites of exorcism. “The Exorcist” is a film that feeds on our most intimate fears and terrors and not a film for the easily frightened. Stars Max Van Sydow as Father Merrin. Based on the book by William Peter Blatty. Mercedes McCambridge is the voice of the Devil. Part of Tubular Bell by Mike Oldfield used on the soundtrack.
